history.content:
I believe when I asked a similar question the answer was yes, the person I'd recommend talking to would be your college (not major) advisor 

------------------------------

Yes, I had this same question about a year ago. You first move your grad date forward by mid March via a petition (for LS), then you have until June-ish to revert it back (although earlier the better, as this could affect your Phase 1 and 2 times).
I believe when I asked a similar question the answer was yes, the person I'd recommend talking to would be your college (not major) advisor

Hi, I am interested in graduating in 3 years and then trying to do a masters in my 4th year (either at Berkeley or somewhere else). I was wondering if in the event that I don't get into a masters program, is it possible to then revert my grad date back to a normal 4 year graduation instead of graduating early?
history.subject: Question about grad date and master applications
